entry.title: CaptnCodr/Fli
entry.summary:
Execute CLI commands from your F# code in F# style!

Fli

Execute CLI commands from your F# code in F# style!

Getting Started

Just open Fli and start ...

For example:

cli {
    Shell CMD
    Command "echo Hello World!"
}
|> Command.execute

that starts CMD.exe as Shell and echo Hello World! is the command to execute.

Executing programs with arguments:

cli {
    Exec "path/to/executable"
    Arguments "--info"
}
|> Command.execute

an example with git:

cli {
    Exec "git"
    Arguments ["commit"; "-m"; "Fixing issue #1337."]
}
|> Command.execute

Add a verb to your executing program:

cli {
    Exec "cmd.exe"
    Verb "runas"
}
|> Command.execute

Implementations

Currently provided Shells:

  • cmd.exe as CMD
  • powershell.exe as PS
  • pwsh.exe as PWSH
  • bash as BASH
  • ...

Inspiration

Use CE's for command line interface commands came in mind while using FsHttp.
